class.name: VoxelBuffer
class.description: This contains dense voxels data storage (every single cell holds data, there is no sparse optimization of space). Works like a normal 3D grid containing a voxel value in each cell. Organized in channels of configurable bit depth. Values can be interpreted either as unsigned integers or normalized floats. See [enum Depth] for more information. Arbitrary metadata can also be stored, either for the whole buffer, or per-voxel, at higher cost. This metadata can get saved and loaded along voxels, however you must make sure the data is serializable (i.e it should not contain nodes or arbitrary objects).

method.name: clear
method.description: Erases all contents of the buffer and resets its size to zero. Channel depths and default values are preserved.

method.name: clear_voxel_metadata
method.description: Erases all per-voxel metadata.

method.name: clear_voxel_metadata_in_area
method.description: Erases per-voxel metadata within the specified area.

method.name: compress_uniform_channels
method.description: Finds channels that have the same value in all their voxels, and reduces memory usage by storing only one value instead. This is effective for example when large parts of the terrain are filled with air.

method.name: copy_channel_from
method.description: Copies all values from the channel of another [VoxelBuffer] into the same channel for the current buffer. The depth formats must match.

method.name: copy_channel_from_area
method.description: Copies values from a channel's sub-region of another [VoxelBuffer] into the same channel for the current buffer, at a specific location. The depth formats must match. If corners of the area represent a negative-size area, they will be sorted back. If coordinates are entirely or partially out of bounds, they will be clipped automatically. Copying across the same buffer to overlapping areas is not supported. You may use an intermediary buffer in this case.

method.name: copy_voxel_metadata_in_area
method.description: Copies per-voxel metadata from a sub-region of another [VoxelBuffer] into the the current buffer, at a specific location. Values will be a shallow copy. If corners of the area represent a negative-size area, they will be sorted back. If coordinates are entirely or partially out of bounds, they will be clipped automatically. Copying across the same buffer to overlapping areas is not supported. You may use an intermediary buffer in this case.

method.name: create
method.description: Clears the buffer and gives it the specified size.

method.name: downscale_to
method.description: Produces a downscaled version of this buffer, by a factor of 2, without any form of interpolation (i.e using nearest-neighbor). Metadata is not copied.

method.name: fill
method.description: Fills one channel of this buffer with a specific raw value.

method.name: fill_area
method.description: Fills an area of a channel in this buffer with a specific raw value.

method.name: fill_f
method.description: Fills one channel of this buffer with a specific float value.

method.name: for_each_voxel_metadata
method.description: Executes a function on every voxel in this buffer which have associated metadata. The function's arguments must be (position: Vector3i, metadata: Variant). IMPORTANT: inserting new or removing metadata from inside this function is not allowed.

method.name: for_each_voxel_metadata_in_area
method.description: Executes a function on every voxel in this buffer which have associated metadata, within the specified area.

method.name: get_block_metadata
method.description: Gets metadata associated to this [VoxelBuffer].

method.name: get_channel_compression
method.description: Gets which compression mode the specified channel has.

method.name: get_channel_depth
method.description: Gets which bit depth the specified channel has.

method.name: get_size
method.description: Gets the 3D size of the buffer in voxels.

method.name: get_voxel
method.description: Gets the raw value of a voxel within this buffer.

method.name: get_voxel_f
method.description: Gets the float value of a voxel within this buffer. You may use this function if you work with SDF volumes (smooth voxels).

method.name: get_voxel_metadata
method.description: Gets the metadata attached to a specific voxel in this buffer.

method.name: get_voxel_tool
method.description: Constructs a [VoxelTool] instance bound to this buffer. This provides access to some extra common functions.

method.name: is_uniform
method.description: Checks if every voxel within a channel has the same value.

method.name: set_block_metadata
method.description: Sets arbitrary data on this buffer. Old data is replaced. Note, this is separate storage from per-voxel metadata. If this [VoxelBuffer] is saved, this metadata will also be saved along voxels, so make sure the data supports serialization (i.e you can't put nodes or arbitrary objects in it).

method.name: set_channel_depth
method.description: Changes the bit depth of a given channel. This controls the range of values a channel can hold. See [enum VoxelBuffer.Depth] for more information.

method.name: set_voxel
method.description: Sets the raw value of a voxel. If you use smooth voxels, you may prefer using [method set_voxel_f].

method.name: set_voxel_f
method.description: Sets the float value of a voxel. This method should be used if you work on SDF data (smooth voxels).

method.name: set_voxel_metadata
method.description: Attaches arbitrary data on a specific voxel. Old data is replaced. If this [VoxelBuffer] is saved, this metadata will also be saved along voxels, so make sure the data supports serialization (i.e you can't put nodes or arbitrary objects in it).

Voxels will be stored with 8 bits. Raw values will range from 0 to 255, and float values will be normalized between -1 and 1 (but will still take 255 possible values). Values outside the range will be clamped. If you use this for smooth voxels, you may take care of scaling SDF data with a small number like 0.1 to reduce precision artifacts.

Voxels will be stored with 16 bits. Raw values will range from 0 to 65,535, and float values will be normalized between -1 and 1 (but will still take 65535 possible values). Values outside the range will be clamped.
Voxels will be stored with 32 bits. Raw values will range from 0 to 4,294,967,295, and float values will use regular IEEE 754 representation ([code]float[/code]).
Voxels will be stored with 64 bits. Raw values will range from 0 to 18,446,744,073,709,551,615, and float values will use regular IEEE 754 representation ([code]double[/code]).
